result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carrie R. Zastrow

records.addlTxt: Warrant vacated on 10/21/22. Appeared late for hearing
Calendar call on November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Case Called: 9:12 a.m. 
Clerk Heather.
INCLUDES: 22CM585, 22CT148, 22CT159, 22CT171, 22CT192.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Defendant FAILS to appear, with Atty Sharon Gisselman in person. 

COURT notes Defendant called last night indicating she was unable to attend Court today.
Atty Gisselman did not hear from her client, notes plea questionnaires have been filed.

ADA Puig requests bench warrant and forfeiture of bond;

COURT authorizes BW $2500.00 to cover all files, and holds BFH in abeyance. 

Adjourned: 9:13 a.m. 


CASE RECALLED: 9:53 a.m.
Same appearances, Defendant NOW appears, pro se.

COURT vacates BW previously ordered. 
COURT holds BFH in abeyance.

previous bond and conditions reinstated.

INCLUDES 22CM585, 22CT148, 22CT159, 22CT171 & 22CT192. No contact with victim(s): Walmart in Rib Mtn.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
